SystemBody

Class representing a system body.

SystemBody differs from Body in that it holds the properties that are used to generate the physics body that is created when the player enters a system. It exists outside of the current space. That is, scripts can use a SystemBody to discover information about a body that exists in another system.

Attributes
index

The body index of the body in its system

Availability

alpha 10

Status

stable

name

The name of the body

Availability

alpha 10

Status

stable

type

The type of the body, as a Constants.BodyType constant

Availability

alpha 10

Status

stable

superType

The supertype of the body, as a Constants.BodySuperType constant

Availability

alpha 10

Status

stable

seed

The random seed used to generate this SystemBody. This is guaranteed to be the same for this body across runs of the same build of the game, and should be used to seed a Rand object when you want to ensure the same random numbers come out each time.

This value is the same is the one available via Body.seed once you enter this system.

Availability

alpha 10

Status

stable

parent

The parent of the body, as a SystemBody. A body orbits its parent.

Availability

alpha 14

Status

stable

population

The population of the body, in billions of people.

Availability

alpha 16

Status

experimental

radius

The radius of the body, in metres (m).

Availability

alpha 16

Status

experimental

mass

The mass of the body, in kilograms (kg).

Availability

alpha 16

Status

experimental

gravity

The gravity on the surface of the body (m/s).

Availability

alpha 21

Status

experimental

periapsis

The periapsis of the body's orbit, in metres (m).

Availability

alpha 16

Status

experimental

apoapsis

The apoapsis of the body's orbit, in metres (m).

Availability

alpha 16

Status

experimental

orbitPeriod

The orbit of the body, around its parent, in days, as a float

Availability

201708

Status

experimental

rotationPeriod

The rotation period of the body, in days

Availability

alpha 16

Status

experimental

semiMajorAxis

The semi-major axis of the orbit, in metres (m).

Availability

alpha 16

Status

experimental

eccentricity

The orbital eccentricity of the body

Availability

alpha 16

Status

experimental

axialTilt

The axial tilt of the body, in radians

Availability

alpha 16

Status

experimental

averageTemp

The average surface temperature of the body, in degrees kelvin

Availability

alpha 16

Status

experimental

metallicity

Returns the measure of metallicity of the body (crust) 0.0 = light (Al, SiO2, etc), 1.0 = heavy (Fe, heavy metals)

Availability

January 2018

Status

experimental

volatileGas

Returns the measure of volatile gas present in the atmosphere of the body 0.0 = no atmosphere, 1.0 = earth atmosphere density, 4.0+ ~= venus

Availability

January 2018

Status

experimental

atmosOxidizing

Returns the compositional value of any atmospheric gasses in the bodys atmosphere (if any) 0.0 = reducing (H2, NH3, etc), 1.0 = oxidising (CO2, O2, etc)

Availability

January 2018

Status

experimental

volatileLiquid

Returns the measure of volatile liquids present on the body 0.0 = none, 1.0 = waterworld (earth = 70%)

Availability

January 2018

Status

experimental

volatileIces

Returns the measure of volatile ices present on the body 0.0 = none, 1.0 = total ice cover (earth = 3%)

Availability

January 2018

Status

experimental

volcanicity

Returns the measure of volcanicity of the body 0.0 = none, 1.0 = lava planet

Availability

January 2018

Status

experimental

life

Returns the measure of life present on the body 0.0 = dead, 1.0 = teeming (~= pandora)

Availability

January 2018

Status

experimental

hasRings

Returns true if the body has a ring or rings of debris or ice in orbit around it

Availability

January 2018

Status

experimental

hasAtmosphere

Returns true if an atmosphere is present, false if not

Availability

alpha 21

Status

experimental

isScoopable

Returns true if the system body can be scoopable, false if not

Availablility

alpha 21

Status
